alert.note: Alert for Moffat; Rio Blanco; Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 04 at 1:53PM MDT until September 04 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Routt County in northwestern Colorado... Southeastern Moffat County in northwestern Colorado... Northeastern Rio Blanco County in northwestern Colorado... * Until 230 PM MDT. * At 152 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles east of Meeker, or 29 miles south of Craig, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Routt, southeastern Moffat and northeastern Rio Blanco Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
